# Elder Helper Services Request for Statement of Capabilities
The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) has a requirement for Elder programming services to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders. This procurement is for a period of 7 months, from September 3, 2024 to March 31, 2025, with the option to extend for one (1) additional year.

## Description of the Requirement
The CSC seeks to engage an Elder Helper to provide spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous offenders in the Warkworth Institution in Ontario. The Elder Helper must assist in supporting the work of Elders and the interdisciplinary team, and provide traditional healing and contemporary treatment interventions.

## Objectives
The objectives of this procurement are to:

* Provide Indigenous programming and Elder Helper services to the Indigenous offender population
* Assist Indigenous offenders in their traditional healing journey
* Promote healing and balance through traditional ceremonies and practices
* Enhance Indigenous programming and services

## Tasks
The Elder Helper must provide the following services:

* Assist Indigenous offenders in benefitting from traditional healing and contemporary treatment interventions
* Ensure an adequate supply of traditional ceremonial materials
* Coordinate and provide supervision for offenders during traditional ceremonies
* Conduct group discussions and teachings
* Assist staff in preparing reports and providing technical support
* Provide counselling services to offenders as directed
* Assist in scheduling ceremonies and provide written notification of these events to appropriate Elders and staff

## Expected Results
The provision of Indigenous programming and Elder Helper services to the Indigenous offender population.

## Reporting and Communications
The Elder Helper must provide time sheets on a monthly basis and submit summary activity reports of their services to the Project Authority or designate.

## Evaluation Criteria
Any interested supplier must demonstrate by way of a statement of capabilities that it meets the following requirements:

* The supplier must be recognized as an Elder or cultural counselor within their own community
* The supplier must have at least 5 years of experience in providing spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous people
* The supplier must have knowledge and experience in traditional healing and ceremonies
* The supplier must meet the essential requirements as outlined in the Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)

This procurement is set-aside for an Indigenous Supplier in accordance with the government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB).
